intro: Stemonurus axillaris, commonly known as the rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically has hairy, upright stems and features small, green, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and appear in clusters near the base of the plant. Stemonurus axillaris is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions.
